meanings.definition: The quality or state of being incorrect or inaccurate.
meanings.sent1: The teacher pointed out the wrongnesses in my math homework.
meanings.sent2: She felt the wrongnesses in the puzzle when the pieces didn't fit together.
meanings.sent3: The wrongnesses in the recipe made the cake taste like soap.
meanings.sent4: The wrongnesses in his argument were as clear as a red stop sign.
meanings.sent5: The wrongnesses of the map led us to get lost in the forest.

meanings.definition: Actions or behaviors that are morally or ethically unacceptable.
meanings.sent1: The wrongnesses of stealing from others is taught at a young age.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't ignore the wrongnesses of cheating on the test.
meanings.sent3: The wrongnesses of lying were evident in his guilty expression.
meanings.sent4: The wrongnesses of bullying echoed through the school halls.
meanings.sent5: The wrongnesses of breaking promises can hurt friendships.
